content.description:
This route was an endeavor to do. Climb the 5.8

Unknown

to the ledge and anchors. From here, you clip a small head in a seam and do a difficult move to a 1/4 buttonhead. From this stance, I did some delicate traversing to a seam where I could get some gear. Keep traversing until you can climb up to the slight ledge below a bulge and some more 1/4"ers. Some steep and strenuous climbing leads to small gear and easier terrain. Continue up until it is easy to traverse back left and to a ledge with a bolted anchor.

The rock is good, but the wandering nature of the climb makes it a route finding adventure.
content.protection:
Slings! Lots of slings or you will be slayed by the rope drag. (2) #3s for the first part of the

Unknown

, 5.8. A set of C3s, nuts, and a few fingers to small hands.
content.location:
This route is above

Unknown

, 5.8, and right of

Unnamed

, 5.11. Look for the old bolts on the face.

content.description:
This is a great route that works a overlaping bulge system. The crux comes high up. You [used to] have to rap off a Mashed Head equalized with a bolt. Someone needs to install another bolt up there.

Eds. Apparently there is a 2 bolt anchor now.
content.protection: A #1 Camalot, some small nuts/cams can help out with the run out, 7-8 QDs, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is 20 feet to the right of

Unknown 1

.

content.description: Go up the right-facing corner, then pass a bulge to a ledge with two good bolts.
content.protection: 2 #3s and some medium sizes and nuts.
content.location: This is between Television Wall and Sunday Wall to the right of a deep drainage in the wall.

content.description: Follow the bushy crack that passes a few dikes. Look for an anchor out right in some light colored rock. It will be a chunk of rope equalized between two bolts.
content.location:
This route starts up the very bushy crack to the immediately to the left of

Unknown 2

. It is LIGHT BLUE in the topo.

content.description:
This is a great climb with a few distinct cruxes. From the easy slab approach, clip a bolt as the wall steepens. Head up to a large jug and mantle/traverse right into the flaring crack system. Continue up until you clip bolt out left where you traverse through a balance sequence to grain a solid finger jam. Lock off and move past the bulge. From here, you can either trend left to a bolt (YELLOW in the topo pic) or go straight up and trend right up easy territory until you reach a bolt. This last crux gets you to the same height for the anchors of

TV3

to which you traverse into.
content.protection: A single set of cams, slings, nuts, and QDs.  A 70m rope is recommended.
content.location: This is a few feet right, past the oak brush patch at the base of the slab. Look for a low bolts on the wall. It is ORANGE on the topo pic.

content.description: This is a good warm-up for the zone. Trend towards the smattering of bolts at the start and at mid-height. Keep following the path of least resistance until anchors are visible. A 70m rope is recommended.
content.protection: Single set from small to #2 with nuts. Slings!
content.location: This is to the right of the large gully drainage and PINK in the topo pic.
